Description: Pair of connected amulets containing dust from the tomb of the Prophet; ornamented with bands of straw and with a leather loop.
Curator's comments: Slip reads: 'Two amulets, formed of dust from the tomb of the Prophet.'
Published in Edward William Lane's (1836) 'An Account of the Manners and Customs of the Modern Egyptians' p. 350
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
